baseline_groups.claim_summary: Closure of the Grand Canal in 1825 increased rebellions in canal-adjacent counties (DiD: Along Canal x Post).
baseline_groups.notes: Coef=0.031 (p<0.001). County and year FE, clustered at county level. N=150,650.

global_notes: Historical DiD studying Grand Canal closure and rebellions in Imperial China. Result robust to FE, controls, province/year drops. Sensitive to winsorization (outlier-driven). Pre-trend test marginally significant (p=0.012). Placebo rivers (Yangtze) show significant effects, raising concerns. Heterogeneity tests all null.
